Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure (?) of woman or child. Head only. Almond shaped eyes. Hair worn up. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis terracottas workshop that dates 3rd to 2nd century BC. Two similar pieces from Naukratis (NA689, NA564) with a parallel from Tell Atrib dated to the late 3rd to early 2nd century BC (Szymańska 2005, no.195). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.438) (Phase 1)
